    evaluate(MyIDictionary<String,IValue> symTable)
    Evaluates the ArithmeticExpression First evaluates left-hand expression and gets the value from it Second evaluates the right-hand expression and gets the value from it Third casts the IntValues value1/value2 to int1/int2 Fourth gets the ACTUAL integers from int1 and int2 via getValue() Fifth based on 'operation', does arithmetic operations with the integers and returns the result

    • evaluate

      public IValue evaluate(MyIDictionary<String,IValue> symTable) throws ADTException, EvaluateException
      Evaluates the ArithmeticExpression First evaluates left-hand expression and gets the value from it Second evaluates the right-hand expression and gets the value from it Third casts the IntValues value1/value2 to int1/int2 Fourth gets the ACTUAL integers from int1 and int2 via getValue() Fifth based on 'operation', does arithmetic operations with the integers and returns the result
      Specified by:
      evaluate in interface IExpression
      Parameters:
      symTable - = current symbol table
      Returns:
      Returns an IntValue that is the result of the operation between e1 and e2
      Throws:
      EvaluateException - If the first or second operand isn't an IntType
      ADTException

    • deepcopy

      public IExpression deepcopy()
      Performs a deepcopy on ArithmeticExpression
      Specified by:
      deepcopy in interface IExpression
      Returns:
      Returns a new ArithmeticExpression object with the same operation, e1 and e2 values
